alert.note: Alert for Baker; Ben Hill; Colquitt; Dougherty; Irwin; Lee; Mitchell; Tift; Turner; Worth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 03 at 12:27PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Irwin, Dougherty, Turner, northeastern Mitchell, central Lee, northeastern Baker, northern Colquitt, Tift, western Ben Hill and Worth Counties through 130 PM EDT... At 1227 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Leslie to near Albany to 10 miles northwest of Baconton. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Newton, Tifton, Albany, Ashburn, Fitzgerald, Sylvester, Leesburg, Putney, Omega, Norman Park, Baconton, Poulan, Doerun, Ty Ty, Phillipsburg, Mystic, Unionville, East Albany, Marine Corps Logistics Base and Turner City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EDT for south central and southwestern Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Baker; Ben Hill; Colquitt; Dougherty; Irwin; Lee; Mitchell; Tift; Turner; Worth
